metadata.Title: CVE-2009-4079 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Redmine 0.8.5 and earlier allows remote attackers to hijack the authentication of users for requests that delete a ticket via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-4079` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

redmine - 0.9.0svn2902-1
redmine-mysql - 0.9.0svn2902-1
redmine-pgsql - 0.9.0svn2902-1
redmine-sqlite - 0.9.0svn2902-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> fixed before package made it into any archive

criterions.comment: redmine package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.0svn2902-1').
